treasury daily and placed in the proper fund unless otherwise expressly provided 292 restrictions of marijuana a no person shall possess control use or give away marijuana or cannabis which is defined as all parts of the plant cannabis sativa l whether growing or not  its seeds or resin  and every compound manufacture salt derivative mixture or preparation of the above unless such possession control or use is pursuant to a license or prescription as provided in public act 196 of 197 as amended this definition does not include the mature stalks of the plant fiber produced from the stalks oil or cake made from the seeds of the plant any other compounds manufacture sale derivative mixture or preparation of the mature stalks except the resin extracted therefrom fiber oil or cake or the sterilized seed of the plant which is incapable of germination b violations of this section shall be civil infractions persons convicted of violating this section shall be fined $2500 for the first offense $5000 for the second offense $10000 for the third or subsequent offense and no incarceration probation nor any other punitive or rehabilitative measure shall be imposed fines and all other costs shall be waived upon proof that the defendant is recommended by a physician practitioner or other qualified health professional to use or provide the marijuana or cannabis for medical treatment the court may waive all or part of the fine upon proof that the defendant attended a substance abuse program it is an affirmative defense to a prosecution under this section that the use or intended use of the marijuana or cannabis relieves or has the potential to relieve the pain disability discomfort or other adverse symptoms of illness or medical treatment or restores maintains or improves or has the potential to restore maintain or improve the health or medical quality of life of the user or intended user or users of the marijuana or cannabis requirements of this subsection shall not be construed to exclude the assertion of other defenses c in all arrests and prosecutions for violations of this section appearance tickets and the relevant procedures set forth in michigan public act 147 of 196 as amended shall be used d no grand rapids police officer or his or her agent shall complain of the possession control use or giving away of marijuana or cannabis to any other authority except the grand rapids city attorney  and the city attorney shall not refer any said complaint to any other authority for prosecution e no grand rapids police officer or his or her agent shall complain and the city attorney shall not refer for prosecution any complaint of the possession control use giving away or cultivation of marijuana or cannabis upon proof that the defendant is recommended by a physician practitioner or other qualified health professional to use or provide the marijuana or cannabis for medical treatment f should the state of michigan enact lesser penalties than that set forth in subsection b above or entirely repeal penalties for the possession control use or giving away of marijuana or cannabis then this section or the relevant portions thereof shall article 2  witnesses before commission clerk to issue subpoenas the city clerk upon instructions from the mayor or any commissioner or the city attorney shall issue subpoenas in the name of the mayor of the city and under the corporate seal of said city which subpoenas shall be signed by the said city clerk directed to any person whom such official ordering the subpoena may deem necessary as a said subpoena to testify concerning such matter or thing or to produce before said commission or committee at said time and place such books records contracts papers or other data as shall be 82002   82713 definitions the following words and phrases as used in this unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context shall have the following meanings 1 accrued benefit means the portion of an allowance earned as of the date of the computation it is a monthly benefit commencing at the minimum service retirement age and computed in accordance with the life allowance formula in the members final average salary and credited service at the time of the computation 2 accumulated contributions means the total of all amounts deducted from the compensations of a member and standing to his or her credit in his or her individual account in the members deposit fund together with regular interest at the rate of three 3% percent per annum compounded annually from and after  3 actuarial equivalent means a benefit of equal reserve value present values will be determined by the actuary based on mortality tables and interest rates established from time to time by the board no change in mortality or interest assumptions shall reduce the accrued benefit of any member determined as of the date of the change 4 allowance or life allowance means the total of the annuity and the pension all allowances shall be paid not later than the last day of each calendar month 4a allowance cap means the agreed upon limit to the product which results when a members years of credited service are multiplied by the benefit multiplier applicable to the member at the time of retirement expressed as a percentage 5 annuity means a monthly amount derived from the accumulated contributions of a member and payable by the system throughout the life of a person or for a temporary period 6 assumed interest means such rate or rates per annum compounded annually as the board shall adopt from time to time 7 beneficiary means any person who is receiving or designated by a member to receive a system benefit except a retirant 8 benefit program means a schedule of benefits or benefit formulas from which the amounts of system benefits can be determined 9 board of trustees or board means the board of trustees of the system 10 the internal revenue as amended 11 compensation general pension system and the police and fire pension system are required to avoid the unnecessary duplication of administrative expenses these matters shall include but not be limited to the concerning benefits any denial of benefits by the board will be stated in writing by the board and delivered or mailed by certified mail return receipt requested to the member or beneficiary within sixty 60 days after the denial the notice will set forth the reasons for the denial in language that may be understood by the member or beneficiary and will specify the system provisions upon which the denial was based if the denial is based on the failure of the member or beneficiary to supply certain materials or information the notice will so state the notice will advise that the denial may be appealed to the board and will include an explanation of the appeal procedure the board will adopt a procedure for reviewing appeals of denials of benefit claims the procedure will include the following a the claimant or his duly authorized representative may initiate an appeal by written request for review delivered to the board not later than sixty 60 days after receipt by the claimant of the notice of denial the board has the authority to extend those time limits a maximum of sixty 60 days upon the claimant or claimants authorized representative showing of good cause or undue hardship b the claimant or his duly authorized representative may review documents pertinent to the appeal and may submit written statements of issues and arguments relevant to the appeal to the board c the board will review the appeal at the next regularly scheduled board meeting which is at least twentyone 21 days after the completed application for review is received the board will return its decision on the appeal not later than sixty 60 days after review in circumstances where the board determines that it needs additional information to make its decision the board will notify the claimant of the need for additional information and delay its decision until the next regularly scheduled board meeting which is at least twentyone 21 days after the additional information is received d the claimant will be advised in writing of the decision on the appeal including the reasons for the decision in language that may be understood by the claimant with references to the system provisions upon which the decision is based e the determination of the board on all matters under this be final and binding on all parties    11398 membership of system 1 the membership of the system shall include all 9704 claims procedure the board will make all determinations concerning benefits any denial of benefits by the board will be stated in writing by the board and delivered or mailed by certified mail return receipt requested to the member or beneficiary within sixty 60 days after the denial the notice will set forth the reasons for the denial in language that may be understood by the member and will specify the system provisions upon which the denial was based if the denial is based on the failure of the member or beneficiary to supply certain materials or information the notice will so state the notice will advise that the denial may be appealed to the board and will include an explanation of the appeal procedure the board will adopt a procedure for reviewing appeals of denials of benefit claims the procedure will include the following a the claimant or his duly authorized representative may initiate an appeal by written request for review delivered to the board not later than sixty 60 days after receipt by the claimant of the notice of denial  b the claimant or his duly authorized representative may review documents pertinent to the appeal and may submit written statements of issues and arguments relevant to the appeal to the board  c the board will return its decision on the appeal not later than sixty 60 days after receipt of the request for review  and d the claimant will be advised in writing of the decision on the appeal including the reasons for the decision in language that may be understood by the claimant with references to the system provisions upon which the decision is based the determination of the board in all matters under this be final and binding on all parties    3194 membership of system 1 the membership of the system shall include all persons of the retired employees of the city of grand rapids or their surviving beneficiaries are receiving retirement allowances which are disparagingly low when compared to the everincreasing cost of living the city commission has determined that it is in furtherance of the public interest to supplement these modest retirement allowances pursuant to this      definitions the following words and phrases as used in this unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context shall have the following meanings 1 annuity means a monthly amount derived from the accumulated contributions of a member and payable by the system throughout the life of a person or for a temporary period 2 allowance means the gross total of the annuity and the pension 3 beneficiary means any person who is receiving or designated by a member to receive a system benefit except a retirant 4 pension means a monthly amount derived from contributions of the employer and payable by the system throughout the life of a person or for a temporary period 5 qualified retirant means a former member of the general retirement system or the police and fire retirement system of the city of grand rapids receiving a system allowance by reason of having been a member and having completed at least twenty 20 years of employment with the city prior to retirement 6 supplemental allowance benefit means the additional benefit paid to qualified retirants or their beneficiaries as computed under this which supplements the monthly allowance received by the qualified retirant or his or her beneficiary from the system supplemental allowance benefits shall be payable from the general fund of the city of grand rapids 7 system means either the city of grand rapids general retirement system or the city of grand rapids police and fire retirement system 8 years retired means the number of full years of retirement completed by a retirant as of each annual computation date beneficiaries shall be entitled to receive credit for the same number of years retired as the qualified retirant they receive their system allowance would have been entitled    121989 computation of supplemental allowance benefit 1 qualified dollars $20000 per month 2 qualified retirants of the police and fire retirement system or their beneficiaries shall be entitled to receive a monthly supplemental allowance benefit equal to one dollar benefit premium from contributions provided by the city of grand rapids the 61st district court or the board of library commissioners of the grand rapids public library pursuant to collective bargaining agreements with the grand rapids employees independent union the intent of this that the payments made will be applied solely to reduce the cost of medicare supplemental benefit coverage and for no other purpose 1 as used in this the words and phrases defined below shall have the indicated meanings a trust fund means contributions set aside in trust for the benefit of designated retired city court and library employees and the accumulated investment income from the investment of those contributions trust fund may also include any voluntary contributions made which are designated to be used for the purpose of this fund trust fund means the total amount in the trust account except as otherwise set out in this b eligible participants means those retirees of the city of grand rapids general retirement system who receive a monthly benefit from the retirement system as a result of having retired on or after  and who are receiving a medicare benefit under federal law as a result of having reached age sixtyfive 65 and eligible beneficiaries as determined by the joint committee defined herein c contribution means that amount that the employer contributes in separate quarterly payments to the trust fund in an amount equal to onehalf of one 05 percent of the annual salary rate including longevity pay of those employees covered by the general retirement system and who upon retirement will be eligible for medicare coverage the quarterly payments provided for in this be made by the employer in january april july and october of each year d joint committee means the sevenmember committee of trustees appointed to administer this trust four 4 members shall be appointed and may be removed by the grand rapids employees independent union under a procedure to be established and administered by the union three 3 members shall be appointed and may be removed by the city manager e investment of trust funds means the placement of trust fund reserves into investments determined by the joint committee to be likely to enhance value of the trust and to provide timely cash flow to meet benefit payment needs as determined by the joint committee f annual benefit amount means the total amount of the trust fund determined by the joint committee to be distributed to insurance companies for medicare supplement benefits for eligible participants g premium means the monthly fee charged for the supplement to medicare parts a and b then being offered to retirees by the employer or an equal amount paid to the retirees designated alternate insurance h alternate insurance means an insurance policy for health care benefits that is individually purchased by the retiree and comparable in nature to that provided by the city of grand rapids to members of the respective bargaining units represented by the grand rapids employees independent union members 2 the joint committee shall have the following duties a the joint committee shall be responsible for supplies fees for professional services custodial fees investment costs and commissions auditing and performance evaluation fees and reimbursement for other expenditures necessary for the proper and efficient operation of the trust fund upon approval by the joint committee the expenses shall be promptly paid by the custodian of the trust fund 3 the amount designated as the annual benefit amount term for which they were appointed except as otherwise provided as to any particular board or commission all boards and commissions shall be subject to the following general provisions 1 any vacancy member of any board or commission for cause but any member shall be entitled to a public hearing on such removal on written demand filed with the appointing authority within ten 10 days after notice of removal has been given to such member such a hearing shall be limited to a statement by the appointing authority of the reason for removal and any response that the removed member makes regarding relations commission footnotes  4  editors note  adopted  repealed the former art 3   and enacted a new art 3 as set out herein the former art 3 pertained to similar subject matter see table for complete derivation statement of public policy and finding of necessity it is hereby declared to be contrary to the public policy of the city of grand rapids for any person to deny any other person the enjoyment of his or her civil rights or for any persons to discriminate against any other person in the exercise of his or her civil rights because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status disability height weight sexual orientation or gender identity it is hereby found that prejudice and discrimination against any individual or group because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status disability height weight sexual orientation or gender identity are inimical to democracy the cornerstone of our american tradition and menace peace and the general public welfare  that to eliminate such prejudice and discrimination instrumentalities of government should be established the citizens of grand rapids may be kept informed of developments in community relations and from which the elected and appointed officials and the departments of this city may obtain expert advice and assistance in adopting measures to keep peace good order and harmony among the citizens of grand rapids  and that such instrumentalities will promote harmony help to avoid intergroup tensions promote good will and ensure equality of treatment and opportunity to all regardless of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status disability height weight sexual orientation or gender identity  101315 created  membership there is hereby created a commission to be known as the community relations commission consisting of nine 9 members to be appointed by the mayor with the approval of the city commission the members of the commission should be selected to the extent possible so as to be representative of the community at large the members shall serve without compensation but shall be reimbursed for expenses necessarily incurred in connection with their duties as members of the commission all terms of members of the commission shall be for three 3 years three 3 members shall be appointed for terms commencing on the first monday in january each year in the event of death resignation or removal from membership of any member his or her successor shall be appointed to serve for the unexpired term of the departed member  101315 duties the duties of the community relations commission shall be as follows a it shall foster mutual understanding and respect among all racially ethnically religiously and culturally diverse groups in the city of grand rapids it shall discourage and prevent discrimination practices toward any such group b it may upon its own initiative or upon referral to it by the city managers designee investigate complaints of particular instances or complaints as to general conditions relative to any tensions practices of discrimination or acts of prejudices against any person or group because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status disability height weight sexual orientation or gender identity and it may conduct public hearings with regard thereto c it shall carry on research projects and obtain factual data to ascertain the status and treatment racially ethnically religiously and culturally diverse groups within the city  and it shall make reports and recommendations to the city commission and the city manager as to its findings of fact relative to existing conditions and as to policies programs and legislation for relief and alleviation of such discriminatory practices and conditions d it shall cooperate with other public governmental or private agencies in developing courses of instruction for presentation in public andor private schools in public libraries at public museums or other suitable places showing and illustrating the contributions of various religious nationality and ethnic groups to the culture tradition and progress of our city state and nation and further showing the deplorable effects and menace of prejudice intolerance and discrimination e it may assist the city manager and his or her designee in the performance of their duties as set forth in this f it shall formulate and carry out programs of community education and information with the object of discouraging and eliminating any such tensions prejudice and discrimination g it shall issue such publications and reports of investigations and research as in its judgment will tend to minimize or eliminate prejudice intolerance race or area tensions and discrimination or which will promote or tend to promote good will h it shall cooperate with and seek the cooperation of federal state and city agencies and departments in carrying out projects within their respective authorities to eliminate intergroup tensions and to promote intergroup harmony it shall recommend to the mayor and to the city commission measures including legislation aimed at improving relations within and among the population as well as improving the ability of the various city departments and agencies to ensure protection of any and all persons and groups from discrimination because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status disability height weight sexual orientation or gender identity it shall advise and may recommend action to any official of competent authority on any matters involving civil rights or the violation thereof  101315 meetings the community relations commission shall meet not less than once a month and shall adopt by majority vote such rules as it shall deem expedient for the conduct of its business it shall elect such officers as it shall deem necessary the chairperson thereof shall appoint such committees as the rules of the community relations commission shall provide and other committees as shall from time to time be found necessary  101315 investigations the obtaining of factual information by the community relations commission in the performance of its duties hereunder is hereby declared to be necessary to its functions in the event any person or persons shall fail to give such necessary information to the community relations commission or any committee or authorized representative thereof the said commission may in its discretion make its report thereof to the city commission pursuant to the city charter title xviii such report shall be deemed and it is hereby declared to be a proceeding or hearing pending before the city commission thereafter upon instructions from the mayor or any commissioner of the city commission or the city attorney proceedings may then be initiated and had pursuant to the provisions of articles 2 and 3 of of title i of the city the city of grand rapids  101315 selfincrimination nothing contained in this be so construed as to require any person in any criminal case to be a witness against himself or herself  101315 civil rights defined employment  the opportunity to obtain employment without discrimination because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status disability height weight sexual orientation or gender identity is hereby recognized and declared to be a civil right further it shall be contrary to the public policy of the city of grand rapids for any employer because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry gender marital status disability height weight sexual orientation or gender identity to refuse to hire or otherwise discriminate against him or her with respect to hire tenure terms conditions or privileges of employment unless such refusal to hire or discriminate is based on a bona fide occupational qualification housing  the opportunity to purchase lease sell hold use and convey dwelling housing or dwelling units without discrimination because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status familial status disability height weight source of lawful income public assistance recipient status sexual orientation or gender identity is hereby recognized and declared to be a civil right it shall not be a violation of this the owner of an owneroccupied onefamily or twofamily dwelling to restrict occupancy public accommodations  the opportunity to enjoy full and equal access to all goods and services accommodations advantages and facilities in all places of public accommodation service amusement and recreation including but not limited to inns hotels motels government housing restaurants and eating places barber shops billiard parlors stores public transportation and conveyances theaters and motion picture houses and educational institutions without discrimination because of race color creed religion national origin ancestry age gender marital status disability height weight familial status source of lawful income public assistance recipient status sexual orientation or gender identity is hereby recognized and declared to be a civil right  101315 secs   reserved article 4  board of art and museum commissioners board of art and commission shall consist of five 5 members appointed by the city manager and confirmed by the city commission 2 the term of office of members of the grand rapids housing commission shall be five 5 in accordance with procedures established in mcl   3 the members of the grand rapids housing commission shall serve without compensation  provided however they may be reimbursed for actual expenses duties vested or permitted to be vested in the housing commission by act 18 of the public acts of 193 ex sess as amended heretofore or hereafter and any laws heretofore or hereafter enacted which are supplemented thereto it being the intention of this vest in the grand rapids housing commission all powers and duties permitted by law 2 the grand rapids housing commission is authorized to act as a payment of employees the grand rapids housing commission may appoint a director who may also serve as secretary and other employees or officers as are necessary the grand rapids housing commission shall prescribe the duties of its officers and employees and shall have the sole authority to fix their compensation and fringe benefits and terms and conditions of employment    8597 financial reporting the grand rapids housing commission shall submit to the city commission and the city comptroller in a form and with such detail as is reasonably determined by the city comptroller to be of said city to sell the real estate embraced therein at any time during the continuance thereof it shall also be the duty of the city manager to negotiate terms of sale of such real estate and report and established by the city commission by and with the aid of the city assessors if it deem it expedient or the city commission may appoint appraisers to examine the property and report on the value reserved article 6  collection of delinquent personal property taxes purpose and intent the purpose and intent of this to implement specifically some of the authority granted to the city treasurer by title ix of the charter of the city of grand rapids to use all means which are lawful for the collection of debts generally to collect delinquent personal property taxes because state law prohibits officials of the political subdivisions of the state from compromising personal property taxes nothing in this be construed as authorizing the release of property from any lien for unpaid taxes penalties and collection fees until such taxes penalties and collection fees have been paid in full  definitions for purposes of this certain terms shall have the following meanings 1 base taxes the amount of taxes originally due without the addition of collection fees or accrued delinquency penalties 2 collection fees those charges imposed for the collection of personal property taxes which are authorized by this by state law and which are added to the base amount of taxes 3 delinquency penalties those charges imposed for nonpayment of taxes by the due date which are authorized by this state law and which are added to the base amount of taxes 4 delinquent personal property taxes taxes levied against personal property pursuant to this state law which have not been paid by their due date 5 personal property tax account an account established by the city treasurer for the levy and collection of personal property taxes for each taxing unit for each years taxes for each taxpayer 6 taxing unit the local government agency imposing the tax involved and for whose use and benefit the tax is collected  ie the city of grand rapids  the county of kent  each public school system with some portion of its district located within the city limits and for which taxes are collected by the city treasurer  contracts for collection authorized the city commission may award professional services contracts to assist the city treasurer in the collection of delinquent personal property taxes under the following conditions 1 contracts may be awarded only to collection agencies properly licensed pursuant to act 299 public acts of michigan of 198 as amended and to duly licensed michigan attorneys 2 in the collection of delinquent personal property taxes collection agencies and attorneys must conform to the requirements and standards imposed upon them by state collection practices statutes applicable to them in the collection of claims or debts as defined in those statutes for collection agencies the relevant statute is act 299 public acts of michigan of 198 as amended thereof being mcla   et seq for attorneys the relevant statute is act 70 public acts of michigan of 198 being mcla   et seq 3 contracts may be awarded only for the collection of delinquent personal property taxes of those taxing units which have authorized their use either by concurring in the award of specific contracts or by providing the city treasurer with separate written authorization valid for all contracts awarded for either a time certain or until revoked 4 the contract fee paid to a collection agency or attorney shall be calculated on an individual delinquent personal property tax account basis in no event shall the fee on each individual delinquent account collected exceed the delinquency penalty and collection fee on such account for purposes of this if less than the full balance in a delinquent account is collected all amounts collected shall be allocated between base taxes collection fee and delinquency penalty on a pro rata basis in the same ratio that each bears to their sum 5 the city commission may require collection agencies and attorneys awarded contracts to thereof and which same shall be public records of his or her office and open to inspection bids the city manager shall advertise for bids at least once in a daily newspaper published in the city of grand rapids and not less than one 1 week before the opening of said bids bids shall be received opened and tabulated by the director of public service who shall report the same together with his or her recommendation thereon to the city manager who shall examine the same together with such report and report the same with his or her recommendation to the city commission together with the reasons upon which said recommendation is based and thereupon the city commission shall pass on said proposals and enter into a contract with any responsible bidder  provided the city commission shall require security for the performance of the proposals tendered and if a bid is accepted security for the performance of any contract entered into and the statutory bond for the protection of material suppliers laborers and subcontractors the city commission shall have the right to reject any and all bids and in case all bids are rejected the city commission may order the city manager to readvertise the same or the city commission may by resolution carried by four 4 votes order the city manager to perform such work and furnish such material himself or herself keeping an itemized account of the cost thereof and reporting the same in writing to the city commission at once after the same shall be completed the city commission shall thereupon examine such report and if found correct order the same paid by resolution duly adopted by at least four 4 votes  provided that the city commission may from time to time by resolution so adopted order payment of the work and materials as the same progresses upon recommendation by the city manager bonds for the purpose of meeting the expense of any public or special improvement or in anticipation of the collection of assessments levied for that purpose the city commission may by resolution or ordinance authorize and direct the mayor city comptroller and city clerk to borrow not to exceed one and onehalf 15 percent of the assessed valuation of the city according to the last preceding city tax roll  provided that the total amount of bonds issued for such purpose and outstanding at any one 1 time shall not exceed three 3 percent of the total assessed valuation of the city according to the last preceding city tax roll  and to issue bonds therefor bearing interest at the rate of not exceeding six 6 percent per annum with interest coupons attached and said bonds shall be made payable in equal yearly amounts for a period of not exceeding ten 10 years from the date of issue as the city commission may direct and which bonds shall be signed by the mayor and countersigned by the city comptroller and attested by the city clerk of said city the said bonds if issued for street or sewer purposes shall be endorsed special improvement bonds year 19  and shall be numbered or lettered consecutively said bonds may be made registered or unregistered and shall not be sold for less than par and the accrued interest if any and be payable at the office of the city treasurer and the proceeds of the same shall be paid to the city treasurer and by him or her placed to the credit of the improvement fund for which said bonds were issued the said bonds shall be paid at maturity and cancelled and shall not be reissued or refunded  delivery of roll to treasurer the special assessment roll as confirmed by the charge as may be applicable thereto shall from the date and time of receipt thereof by the city treasurer constitute a lien upon the respective lots or parcels of land assessed and until paid shall be a charge against the respective owners of the several lots and parcels of land such lien shall be of the same character and effect as the lien created for city taxes and shall include accrued interest and penalties no judgment or decree nor any act of the city commission vacating a special assessment shall destroy or impair the lien of the city on the premises assessed for such amount of the allowed to make any objections not therein specified if on the day fixed in such notice for the hearing of such petition or on the day following that day it shall be made to appear to the court that any person has been prevented from filing his or her objection to any tax without any fault on his or her part such further time may be granted for that purpose as may seem proper not exceeding five 5 days the court shall give precedence to the hearing of such petition over all other business shall examine consider and determine the matters therein stated and objections made in a summary manner without other pleadings and make final decree thereon as the right of the case may be the taxes specified in the petition shall be presumed to be legal and a decree be made thereof unless the contrary is proven evidence shall be taken in open court all oral testimony shall at the request of any person interested be taken in shorthand by the court reporter the court may make such orders from time to time as may be necessary to facilitate the proceedings and shall decide all questions as to the admissibility of evidence and the decisions so made shall be final and not subject to review or appeal  of added a new ch 13 as herein set out cross reference civil emergency ch 161 state law reference emergency preparedness act mcl  et seq msa 11 et seq article 1  intent and purpose intent and purpose it is the intent and purpose of this establish an organization that will ensure the complete and efficient utilization of all city resources during periods of emergency and disaster  52284 coordinating agency the city of grand rapids office of emergency management will be the coordinating agency responsible for citywide emergency preparedness  it will provide the means the city manager mayor and city commission may exercise the authority and discharge the responsibilities vested in them by this mcl  1990 pa5o  52284 other agencies  etc not affected by not relieve any elected officials or city departments of the normal responsibilities or authority given by general law or local ordinance nor will it affect the work of the american red cross or other volunteer agencies organized for relief in a natural disaster  52284 article 2  definitions definitions for the purpose of this certain words used herein are defined as follows 1 disaster means an occurrence or imminent threat of widespread or severe damage injury or loss of life or property resulting from any natural or manmade cause including but not limited to fire flood snow ice or wind storm wave action oil spills water contamination requiring emergency action to avert danger or damage utility failure hazardous peacetime radiological incident major transportation accident epidemic air contamination blight drought infestation explosion riot or hostile military or paramilitary action riots and other civil disorders are not within the meaning of this term unless they directly result from and are an aggravating element of the disaster 2 district coordinator means the state police district emergency services coordinator or his or her authorized representative 3 emergency management shall have a broad meaning to include preparations for and relief from the affects of natural and manmade disasters as defined herein and to include civil defense 4 emergency management coordinator shall mean the person appointed to coordinate emergency management within the city of grand rapids as prescribed in this emergency management forces means all disaster relief forces  all agencies of the city government private and volunteer personnel public officers and employees  and all other persons or groups of persons having duties or responsibilities under this or pursuant to a lawful order or directive authorized by this emergency management volunteer shall mean any person duly registered and appointed by the director and assigned to participate in the emergency management activity 7 pursuant to this activates the disaster response and recovery aspects of the city of grand rapids emergency operations plan and authorizes the deployment and use of any emergency management forces to which the plan applies  52284 article 3  organization for emergency management authorized  responsible official the city manager is hereby authorized and directed to create an organization to prepare for community disasters utilizing to the fullest extent existing agencies within the city the city manager as administrative head of city government shall be responsible for the direction of the emergency management forces of the city working with the emergency management coordinator  52284 composition  disaster contingency fund the organization for providing emergency management shall consist of the following 1 the city of grand rapids office of emergency management shall be administered by the emergency management coordinator such assistants and other employees as are deemed necessary for the proper functioning of the organization will be assigned as needed 2 the employees equipment and facilities of all city departments boards institutions and commissions suitable for or adaptable to emergency management activities may be designated as part of the total emergency management forces such designations shall be by the city manager 3 a disaster contingency fund in a separate account within the fire department budget set up to cover disaster expenses and upon exhaustion of the fund to make the city eligible for state assistance  52284 cooperation and assistance of emergency management forces all officers and employees of departments commissions boards institutions and other agencies of city government designated by the city manager as emergency management forces shall cooperate with the emergency management coordinator in the formulation of the emergency operations plan and they shall assist the coordinator in all matters pursuant to the provisions of this  52284 article 4  emergency management coordinator  deputies  assistants appointment of coordinator  qualifications the city manager shall appoint an emergency management coordinator who shall be a person with the personal attributes experience and training needed to coordinate the activities of the agencies departments and individuals within the city to protect the public health safety and welfare during emergency situations and disasters  52284 appointment of deputy coordinators deputy emergency management coordinators shall be appointed by the city manager to work with the coordinator on emergency planning matters deputy coordinators shall be selected and shall serve as follows 1 there shall be one such deputy coordinator appointed from each key unit of the emergency management organizational structure as contained in the emergency operations plan 2 deputy coordinators shall assume the duties of the coordinator whenever he or she is unavailable during disaster or emergency situations in the order designated by the city manager  52284 assistants assistants shall be designated by the coordinator and each deputy coordinator to assist them with their emergency management responsibilities as contained in this in the emergency operations plan  52284 article 5  responsibilities of the mayor declaring state of emergency under the following circumstances the mayor may declare a state of emergency exists in the city of grand rapids thereby authorizing the utilization of emergency management forces in accordance with the city of grand rapids emergency operations plan 1 whenever on the basis of information received from authoritative sources he or she feels that a largescale disaster or emergency situation in the city is imminent 2 during any period of disaster in the city and thereafter as long as he or she shall deem it necessary  52284 cross reference civil emergency proclamation   declaring state of disaster in the event a disaster occurs which has not yet been declared a state of disaster by the governor and the mayor determines that the situation is beyond the control of the city the mayor may request the governor to declare a state of disaster by instructing the emergency services coordinator to notify the district coordinator in accordance with the procedures outlined in mcl  1990 pa 50 the mayor shall comply with the orders of the director of the department of state police on matters of emergency preparedness  52284 state law reference notification procedures mcl  msa 24 emergency interim successors consistent with the requirements of disaster or local emergency the city manager with the advise and consent of the city commission shall have the authority 1 to assemble and utilize the emergency management forces in accordance with the city of grand rapids emergency operations plan and prescribe the manner and conditions of the use of such emergency management forces  2 to appropriate and expend funds make contracts obtain and distribute equipment materials and supplies for disaster purposes  3 to provide for the health and safety of persons and property including emergency assistance to the victims of a disaster  4 to direct and coordinate the development of disaster plans and programs in accordance with the policies and plans established by the appropriate federal and state agencies and this   5 to appoint employ remove or provide with or without compensation rescue teams auxiliary fire and police personnel and other disaster workers  6 to assign and make available for duty the employees property or equipment of the city relating to fire fighting  engineering  rescue  health medical and related services  police  transportation  construction  and similar items or service for disaster relief purposes within or without the physical limits of the city as ordered by the governor or the director of the state police  52284 waiver of legal requirements authorized in event of attack in the event of foreign general responsibilities the emergency management coordinator shall be responsible at the direction of the city manager for the administration planning coordination and operation of all emergency preparedness activities in the city he or she shall maintain liaison with the county state and federal authorities and the authorities of adjacent and nearby political subdivisions so as to ensure the most effective emergency operations  52284 duties the emergency management coordinators duties shall include but not be limited to the following 1 development of the city of grand rapids emergency operations plan and any other appropriate disaster plans for the immediate use of all of the facilities equipment manpower and other resources of the city for the purpose of minimizing or preventing damage to persons or property  and protecting and restoring to usefulness governmental services and public utilities necessary for the public health safety and general welfare  2 coordinating the recruitment and training of volunteer personnel and agencies to augment the personnel and facilities of the city for emergency purposes  3 through public information programs educating the population as to actions necessary and required for the protection of persons and property in case of a disaster  4 conducting practice alerts and exercises to ensure the efficient operation of the citys emergency organization and to familiarize residents of the city with emergency regulations procedures and operations  5 coordinating the activity of all other public and private agencies engaged in any emergency or disaster relief programs  6 negotiating with owners or persons in control of buildings or other property for the use of such buildings or property for emergency or disaster relief purposes and designating suitable buildings as public shelters  7 establishing and maintaining administrative control over a local radiological defense program to include emergency preparations for both peacetime radiation incidents and international wartime disasters  8 coordinating city emergency preparedness activities with the county of kent other municipalities located therein and adjacent counties and to develop mutual aid arrangements with such other jurisdictions  52284 article 8  volunteers  appointments  records volunteers authorized each department commission board or other agency of city government may at any time appoint or authorize the appointment of volunteer citizens to augment the personnel of such city department commission board or agency in time of emergency such individuals shall be enrolled as emergency management volunteers and shall be subject to the rules and regulations set forth by the respective department commission board or agency head for such volunteers  52284 appointment by coordinator  records the emergency management coordinator may enlist volunteer citizens to form the personnel of an emergency service for which the city has no counterpart or to temporarily augment personnel of the city engaged in emergency activities and shall maintain formal records of all such volunteers  52284 article 9  rights of city employees retention of rights  privileges  compensation city employees assigned to duty as part of the emergency management forces pursuant to the provisions of this retain all of the rights privileges and immunities of city employees and shall receive the compensation incident to their employment  52284 article 10  no governmental or private liability indemnification of city and its agents this an exercise by the city of its governmental functions for the protection of the public health safety and general welfare as such neither the city nor agents and representatives of the city nor any individual receiver firm partnership corporation association nor trustee nor any of the agents thereof acting in good faith carrying out complying with or attempting to comply with this be liable for any damage sustained to persons or property as a result of said activity except as may be provided pursuant to state law  52284 persons in control of real estate used by city not to be liable any person owning or controlling real estate or other premises who voluntarily and without compensation grants the city the right to inspect designate and use the whole or any part of such real estate or premises for the purpose of sheltering persons during a disaster or during an authorized practice disaster exercise shall not be civilly liable for the death of or injury to any person on or about such real estate or about such real estate or premises under such license privilege or other permission or for loss of or damage to the property of such person  52284 article 11  severability a regular session not less than one 1 week after the receipt of such special assessment roll from the assessor and at the time and place specified in the notice given by the assessor as required by the city commission shall act thereon as a board of review and shall continue to act at such other times as may be necessary and as it shall from time to time designate any person may appeal in writing to the city commission acting as such board of review at any time prior to the opening of its first session as such board of review the city commission as such board of review shall have the power to correct or change the whole or any part of such special assessment roll or to return it to the assessor for reassessment in which latter case it shall take the same course as an original special assessment roll at such time as the city commission sitting as a board of review is satisfied with the special assessment roll and is of the opinion that such special assessment roll results in the assessments being levied in accordance with the benefits it shall cause such determination to be entered upon its minutes thereafter the city commission shall adopt a resolution ratifying and certified to by the city clerk as correct shall be at once delivered with said assessment roll to the city assessor  51209 delivery of roll to treasurer the special assessment roll as confirmed by the administrative charge as may be applicable thereto shall from the date and time of receipt thereof by the city treasurer constitute a lien upon the respective parcels of land or interest in land assessed and until paid shall be a charge against the respective owners of the several parcels of land or interest in land such lien shall be of the same character and effect as the lien created for city taxes and shall include accrued interest and penalties no judgment or decree nor any act of the city commission vacating a special assessment shall destroy or impair the lien of the city on the premises assessed for such amount of the assessment as may be equitably charged against the same for a special assessment to provide ongoing activity exceeding one 1 year in duration a separate lien shall be established for each annual installment for the first annual installment the lien shall be established as of the date and time of the receipt of the special assessment roll by the city treasurer for the second annual installment the lien shall be established on the first anniversary of receipt of the roll by the city treasurer  for the third installment it shall be the second anniversary date  for the fourth installment it shall be the third anniversary date  for the fifth installment it shall be the fourth anniversary of receipt of the roll by the city treasurer  51209 deficiency assessments the city commission may provide for spreading of an additional assessment for any improvement in case it determines that the former assessment or assessments will not produce sufficient funds to pay for a public improvement or ongoing activity such additional assessment shall be spread upon a supplemental roll which shall conform so far as may be practical to the original roll for such improvement and shall be made reviewed delivered collected accounted for and returned in the same manner as the original roll and all sales and redemptions of property therein described shall be made in the same manner as the sales and redemption upon said original roll  51209 notice of assessment upon receipt of a special assessment roll with the proper warrant for such purpose statements are mailed where the special assessment roll is divided into more than one 1 installment published notice of the second and subsequent installments need not be given but mailed notice to the owner as shown on the current tax assessment rolls of the city stating the due date and amount of the next installment shall be deemed sufficient  51209 interest on unpaid installments in addition to the principal amount of each annual installment there shall be added thereto and collected from the special assessment roll by the city treasurer as part of each annual installment interest at a rate which shall be determined by the city commission which shall be adjusted to a rate equal to the rate borne by the bonds or other evidences of indebtedness issued or authorized to defray the cost plus one 1 percentum per annum on the entire unpaid balance of the special assessment commencing with the due date of the first installment and computed to the due date of each particular installment in addition to said annual interest in the event that any special assessment or installment thereof shall not be paid within one 1 month of the due date thereof penalties shall thereafter be charged and added to said past due assessment or installment in lieu of further interest on said installment as provided in of title i of the the city of grand rapids such penalties shall be collected at the same time and in the same manner as the special assessments and interest thereon are collected the entire assessment or the first installment thereof if divided into installments may be paid during the first month after the due date thereof without interest  51209 delinquent installments when any special assessment or any installment thereof when divided into installments shall have been due and the grand rapids water system shall be and remain under the management supervision and control of the city manager who may employ or designate such person or persons in such capacity or capacities as he or she deems advisable to carry out the efficient management and operation of the system the city manager or his or her designee may make such rules orders or regulations as he or she deems advisable and necessary to assure the efficient management and operation of the system  subject however to the rights powers and duties with respect thereto which are reserved by law to the city commission of grand rapids  public water connection required the owner of each house building or other structure equipped with plumbing fixtures and used for human occupancy employment recreation or other potable use eg domestic use situated within or outside the city and abutting any street alley rightofway or public utility easement in which there is located or may in the future be located a public watermain served by the city water system shall at her his or its expense install suitable plumbing facilities therein and to connect such facilities directly to the public watermain provided said public watermain is within a two hundred 200 foot radius of the house building or other structure where connection will occur and provided further such connection shall not be required to a house building or other structure where on the effective date of this was served by a private water well until such time as such private water well fails and the local health agency governing private water wells has determined that such failure exists and that it is unable to issue a permit for repair or replacement of such failed well within the parcel of property where the failed well is located well failure shall be as determined and defined by the local health agency governing private water wells within the areas served by the water system except as provided in the immediately preceding sentences all domestic water usage at such connected house building or structure shall be water system  private wells shall not be permitted to provide domestic water service to such house building or structure  and once connected to the public water system disconnection shall be prohibited it shall be the owners responsibility to plug or cap the abandoned domestic water well and contact the local health agency that governs private water wells for proper procedures for plugging and capping such abandoned domestic water wells notwithstanding any current or future agreement between the city and another municipality being served by the city water system said municipality shall have the option of adopting the provisions of this section  113010 standards and regulations standards and regulations established in this pursuant hereto are deemed to be the absolute minimum consistent with the preservation of the public health safety and welfare and to fulfill the obligations of the will promote the public health safety and welfare therefore it is the public policy of the city commission to encourage and facilitate the elimination of such lead pipes provisions of subsection 3 hereof and it is further the intent of the city commission that such provisions be liberally construed to further this public policy 3 the city will assist residential property owners to eliminate lead pipe water service connections in the following situations under the following terms and conditions a category a whenever the city undertakes a street watermain or sewer main construction or improvement project and the city engineer deems that the nature of the project lends itself to the elimination and replacement of lead pipe water service connections with a minimum of additional cost and disruption of sidewalks and other improvements the city engineer will notify the owners of all residential properties abutting the project for which the lead pipe water service connections could be replaced during project construction with such minimum cost and disruption that they can have such connections replaced at their cost at the then current standard category a rates established by resolution of the city commission pursuant to this subsection such notice shall be by such means as shall be reasonably calculated to provide actual notice and understanding of the options available the city engineer shall keep an appropriate record of all such notices and the responses received notices given under this category a must specify a date by which an affirmative response must be received in order to receive the advantages of minimum disruption and the rates established for category a b category b for those residential properties which abutted a city project described in a above completed not more than three 3 years previously and whose then current owners had received notice of the opportunity to eliminate and replace their lead pipe water service connections at category a rates but declined to do so the current owners may apply for replacement of such service connections at their cost at the then current standard category b rates established by resolution of the city commission pursuant to this subsection c category c for those residential properties which do not abut a current project described in 1 above and have not abutted such a project which has been completed less than three 3 years previously the owners may apply for replacement of their lead pipe water service connections at their cost at the then current standard category c rates established by resolution of the city commission pursuant to this subsection d the city commission by resolution from time to time shall establish standard rates for each of the three 3 separate categories of properties stated above in the establishment of such rates the city commission shall consider the actual cost differences and the differing degree of disruption of sidewalks and other facilities caused by elimination and replacement of lead pipe water service connections under the three 3 categories of properties as well as any other factors it deems relevant for the first year the integrated water connection base fees shall be adjusted by a percentage which is determined by the annual change in the consumer price index the index calculated as follows a the consumer price index shall be that index referred to as the consumer price index us city average all urban consumers published by the us department of laborbureau of statistics 198284 100 in the event the method of determining the index is substantially altered the basis for determining the annual change thereafter shall be the index which is most comparable to the index described above b for the purpose of computing the percentage change each calendar year the index for the month of august for the prior calendar year shall be subtracted from the index for the immediately preceding august the result so obtained if positive shall be divided by the index for the month of august for the prior calendar year to obtain the percentage increase which shall be applied to the then current integrated water connection base fee schedule to determine the new calendar year schedule the foregoing integrated connection fee is due and payable at the time a user receives a permit to connect to the water system assure the quality of the wastewater discharged by the publicly owned treatment works potw to prevent the degradation of the grand river  2 that there is a need to protect the biological systems state and federal laws  71310 purposes and objectives the purpose of this to establish standards rules and regulations with respect to the use of the potw to provide for rates and charges for connection to and use of the system to establish limits for the discharge of pollutants into the system and to prevent the pollution of the environment 1 this forth requirements for dischargers into the grand rapids wastewater collection and treatment systems and enables the grand rapids system to protect the public health and environment in conformity with all applicable state and federal laws relating thereto 2 the objectives of this a to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the potw which interfere with the normal operation of the system or contaminate the resulting sludge b to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the potw which do not receive adequate treatment in the potw and which will pass system into receiving waters or the atmosphere or otherwise be incompatible with the system c to improve the opportunity to recycle and reclaim wastewater and sludge from the system 3 this for the issuance of permits and discharge authorizations for the regulation of it would be subject to the following conditions a anticipated bypass  if an industrial user knows in advance of the need for a bypass the user shall submit prior notice to the potw if possible at be provided within five 5 days of becoming aware of the bypass the written submission shall contain a description of the bypass and its cause the dates and if the bypass has not been corrected the where such a location would be impractical or cause undue hardship on the discharger the city manager may concur with the facility being constructed in the public rightofway providing that the permit condition 2 there shall be ample room in or near such sampling facilities to allow accurate sampling and preparation of samples for analysis the facility sampling and measuring equipment shall be maintained at all times in a safe and proper operating condition at the expense of the discharger 3 all required monitoring facilities shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with all before the city manager why the proposed enforcement action should not be taken the notice of the hearing shall be served no less than ten 10 days before the hearing service may be made on any agent improper activities of the discharger appeal of such order may be taken by the discharger in accordance with applicable state law 4 compliance order a compliance order directs the discharger to achieve compliance by a date specified in the order compliance orders require industrial users to develop management practices spill prevention programs and related potw industrial pretreatment program requirements 5 stop work order where there is work in progress that constitutes causes or is causing a violation of any provision of this the city manager may issue a stop work order to discharge permit issued pursuant hereto shall inform the city manager immediately upon becoming aware of the upset the city manager shall make a determination whether this discharge can continue upon the city manager allowing the discharge to continue a written followup report thereof shall be filed by the discharger with the city manager within five 5 days the report shall include a a description of the upset the cause thereof and the upsets impact on a dischargers compliance status  b the duration of noncompliance including exact dates and time of noncompliance and if noncompliance continues the time by which compliance is reasonably expected to occur  and c all steps taken or to be taken to reduce eliminate and prevent recurrence of such upset or other conditions of noncompliance 2 a documented and verified operating upset shall be an affirmative defense to any enforcement action brought by the city manager against a discharger for any noncompliance with this any discharge permit issued pursuant hereto which arises out of violations alleged to have occurred during the period of the upset it will not however be a defense to an action for damages to the potw or to persons property or natural resources caused by the upset an upset will be considered documented and bona fide only if the discharger complies with 1 and with 40 cfr 40316c and rule  of the mac in any enforcement proceeding the user seeking to establish the occurrence of an upset shall have the burden of proof 3 the user shall have controlled production of all discharges to the extent necessary to maintain compliance with pretreatment standards upon reduction loss or failure of its treatment facility until the facility is restored or an alternative method of treatment is provided this requirement applies in the situation where among other things the primary source of power of the treatment facility is reduced lost or fails 4 conditions necessary for the demonstration of a bona fide upset  a user who wishes to establish the affirmative defense of an operating upset shall demonstrate signed contemporaneous operating logs or other relevant evidence that a an upset occurred and the user can identify the cause of the upset  b the facility was at the time being operated in a prudent and appropriate manner and in compliance with applicable operation and maintenance procedures  c the user notified the city manager immediately upon becoming aware of the upset  and d a written submission containing the following information was provided within five 5 days of commencement of the upset 1 a description of the discharge and cause of noncompliance  2 the period of noncompliance including exact dates and times or if not corrected the anticipated time the noncompliance was expected to continue  and 3 steps taken to reduce eliminate and prevent recurrence of the noncompliance  71310 article 6  penalties criminal and civil liability 1 any person in violation of this or of any estimate of former consumption of comparable quarters in preceding three 3 years 3 the total amount of the sewer charges shall be the amount of the bill the water business office shall assign due dates to be no less than fifteen 15 days from the date of mailing of the bill there shall be no discount for early payment in the event that the bill is not paid by the due date a ten 10 percent penalty is added to the net amount and both become due and payable all remittances by mail must be postmarked on or before the due date to entitle the user to pay only the net amount when the due date falls on a legal holiday saturday or sunday the net amount will be accepted on the first business day following failure to receive a bill shall not entitle a customer to pay the net amount unless it can be shown from city records that the bill was not sent 4 if payment is not received within seven 7 days of the due date on the bill a reminder notice shall be sent by first class mail to inform the user that the account is overdue 5 if payment is not received or satisfactory arrangements have not been made within thirty 30 days of the due date on the bill a shutoff notice will be sent by first class mail to inform the user that failure to respond can result in termination of water service this notice will also inform the user that if heshe has a question regarding the bill heshe should contact the water business office if payment is not received or satisfactory arrangements have not been made within seven 7 days after the shutoff notice is sent to the user the watersewer service shall be shut off no service that has been disconnected due to nonpayment shall be restored until all pastdue bills are paid or satisfactory arrangements for such payment are made at the water business office 6 whenever sewer service has been furnished to a premises and it is determined that i the water business office has not rendered a bill for the service  and ii the user has done everything normally required of himher a backbill covering the period shall be sent to the user however the period covered by the backbill shall not exceed three 3 years if it is determined that the user has not done everything normally required of himher a backbill shall be sent to the owner of the premises covering the period that service was rendered but not to exceed six 6 years the backbill will include the monthly service charge at the rate in effect for the period covered plus the commodity rate times the estimated volume of sewage used based upon the best available data in the absence of a city water meter the sewer volume for domestic customers shall be the average usage per quarter for domestic users as determined by the annual rate study in the absence of a city water meter commercial and industrial customers shall be required to install metering devices pursuant to 5 of this to accurately record waste discharge into the system the amount of the backbill will be computed by using the current meter readings for the comparable quarters 7 when a tenant is responsible for payment of bills and a lease has been executed containing a provision that the lessor is not liable for sewer charges then it shall be the responsibility of the lessor to so notify the water business office with an affidavit signed by both parties and thereby request a waiver of the lien privilege the affidavit must state the pertinent provision of the lease and the expiration thereof upon receipt of such notification the potw will waive its lien privilege and sewer bills to the lessee within the term of the affidavit shall not be a lien against the property upon expiration a new affidavit must be submitted to retain the lien waiver without such notification sewer bills will be a lien against the property served regardless of any lease provisions between the parties 8 charges for sewage disposal service furnished to any premise within the city shall be made pursuant to city or statute the lien remedy does not preclude any other remedy provided in law those premises outside the city that are served by the system that have delinquent bills will be certified to their governmental unit for collection as provided in the contract between the city and the governmental unit 9 when the water business office has received and approved a request from the property owner for waiver of the lien privilege then a cash deposit will be required of the lessee as security for payment of all sewer charges said cash deposit shall be equal to three 3 times the quarterly bill for sewer charges but in no case less than the minimum deposit schedule as referred to in appendix i of the water department rules and regulations 10 the water business office shall refund a deposit and the accrued interest thereon upon satisfactory payment by the user on or before the due date of all proper charges for sewer service for a period of twelve 12 successive billing quarters for these purposes a payment will be considered satisfactory if made prior to the issuance of any notice of discontinuation of service for nonpayment users who have established credit by the satisfactory payment of sewer charges at one 1 premises shall not be required to make deposits at a subsequent premises unless the deposit at the subsequent premises would exceed the previous one by greater than one hundred 100 percent a user who has been refunded hisher deposit shall be required to remake a security deposit in the event that hisher service is discontinued for nonpayment upon termination of service the deposit with accrued interest shall be credited to the final bill and the balance if any shall be promptly returned to the user 11 the water business office will apply interest to the deposit accounts of all users with security deposits this interest shall be at the rate of six 6 percent per annum interest will be credited to the deposit account annually as of june 30 and said assessment district or a new residential plot the over sizing share is the material difference in cost of the oversized sewer  b in a commercial industrial or high density residential development service to a local service area and is not used as part of the larger network then the entire cost of the enlargement will be treated in the same manner as a normal sized local collector line and the
