state law  71018 recovery of city costs and expenses purpose the city finds that a significant number of the traffic arrests and traffic accidents in the city involve drivers operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of intoxicants such as alcoholic beverages or a controlled substance or a combination thereof furthermore the city finds that there is a greater likelihood of personal injury or property damage in accidents involving a driver operating under the influence of intoxicants as a result the city finds that a greater operational and financial burden has been placed on the citys public safety services by persons operating a motor vehicle under the influence of intoxicants and that it is necessary to recover these increased costs of enforcement activities caused by such persons as expressly is authorized by mcl 7691f  definitions for the purpose of this chapter the terms listed below shall have the following meanings 1 emergency response shall mean a the providing sending andor utilizing police firefighting andor emergency rescue services by the city to a motor vehicle accident in which one or more drivers were operating a motor vehicle under the influence of one or more intoxicants  or b the making of a traffic stop and arrest by a law enforcement officer when the driver is or was operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of one or more intoxicants 2 expense of emergency response shall mean the direct costs associated with the occurrence of an emergency response these costs shall include but are not limited to the following a the salaries or wages including overtime pay of law enforcement personnel for time spent responding to the incident arresting the person processing the person after the arrest preparing reports on the incident investigating the incident and collecting and analyzing evidence including determining blood alcohol content and determining the presence of and identifying controlled substances or other intoxicants  b the salaries and wages including overtime pay of fire department personnel in responding to and providing firefighting rescue andor emergency medical services in relation to the incident  c the cost of medical supplies lost or expended by fire department personnel in providing services in relation to the incident  d the salaries wages and other compensation including but not limited to overtime pay of prosecution personnel for time spent investigating and prosecuting the offense or offenses resulting in conviction 3 operating under the influence of one or more intoxicants shall mean a operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of an alcoholic beverage controlled substance or a combination of intoxicants  or b operating with an unlawful blood alcohol content as defined by the michigan vehicle   or c operating while visibly impaired due to the consumption of alcoholic beverages controlled substances or a combination of intoxicants  liability for expense of an emergency response 1 any person is liable for the expense of an emergency response if that person while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance or a combination of intoxicating liquor and a controlled substance proximately causes any incident resulting in an emergency response as defined by this chapter 2 for the purpose of this a person is under the influence of an intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance or the combination of an intoxicating liquor and a controlled substance when his or her physical or mental abilities are impaired to a degree that he or she no longer has the ability to operate a motor vehicle with the caution characteristic of a sober person of ordinary prudence regardless whether such person is charged or convicted 3 it shall be presumed that a person was operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of an intoxicating liquor if a chemical analysis of his or her blood urine or breath indicates that the amount of alcohol in his or her blood was in excess of seven onehundredths 007 percent 4 this be construed to impose a responsibility and liability of a civil nature on the part of the operator of the motor vehicle and shall not be construed to conflict contravene enlarge or reduce any criminal liability or responsibility including fines and cost which may be imposed by a court on a person who is convicted of any criminal offense arising from the incident that resulted in an emergency response  cost recovery schedule 1 the police department fire department and city attorney shall periodically evaluate the actual costs incurred in making such emergency responses and determine an average cost during emergency responses this amount shall be amended from time to time to reflect increases or decreases in the salaries of all personnel along with the costs for police vehicles and other necessary equipment 2 the city attorney or his or her designee shall forward the average cost developed in subsection 1 of this section to the district court and circuit court having jurisdiction over the city this cost as restitution to the city may be imposed by the court during the imposition of any sentence upon any person liable under this section  collection and enforcement 1 the amount ordered to be paid under this chapter shall be paid to the clerk of the court who shall transmit the payment amount to the city treasurer 2 if not otherwise ordered by the court the reimbursement amount ordered shall be made immediately the court may order that reimbursement be made within a specified period or in specified installments 3 if the person convicted is placed on probation any reimbursement ordered under this section shall be a condition of that probation 4 a court order for reimbursement under this be enforced in the same manner as a judgment in a civil action 5 in the event that a person who is subject to liability under this not charged or convicted of any criminal offense arising from the incident that resulted in an emergency response the city treasurer shall submit a bill for recovery of costs by first class mail to the person liable for the expenses as set forth in this 6 a person who receives a bill from the city treasurer under subsection 5 of this section shall pay the bill within thirty 30 days of receipt if payment is not received by the city within such thirtyday period the city treasurer may request the city attorney to institute a civil action on behalf of the city in the same manner as in the case of an obligation under a contract express or implied  secs
